Title: Ruelle operators with two complex parameters and applications

Abstract: For a C2 weak-mixing Axiom-A flow ϕt:M⟶M on a Riemannian manifold M and a basic set Λ for ϕt, we consider the Ruelle transfer operator Lf−sτ+zg, where f and g are real-valued Holder functions on Λ, τ is the roof function and s,z are complex parameters. Under some assumptions about ϕt for arbitrary Holder f,g, we establish estimates for the iterations of this Ruelle operator when |Imz|≤B|Ims|ν for some constants B>0, 0<ν<1 (ν=1 for Lipschitz f,g), in the spirit of the estimates for operators with one complex parameter (see [2,11,12]). Applying these estimates, we obtain a non-zero analytic extension of the zeta function ζ(s,z) for Pf−ϵ<Re(s)≤Pf and |z| small enough with a simple pole at s=s(z). Two other applications are considered as well: the first concerns the Hannay–Ozorio de Almeida sum formula, while the second deals with the asymptotic of the counting function πF(T) for weighted primitive periods of the flow ϕt.
